alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Essex, north central Suffolk and east central Middlesex Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saugus, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Boston, Lynn, Malden, Revere, Peabody, Everett, Salem, Beverly, Chelsea, Gloucester, Melrose, Saugus, Danvers, Wakefield, Reading, Stoneham, Marblehead, Winthrop, Swampscott, and Lynnfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
